entry.title: Apache Kylin Installation in Hortonworks HDP Sandbox
entry.content: Prerequisite: Install Oracle VirtualBoxDownload the HDP on Hortonworks SandboxImport the HDP on Hortonworks Sandbox in the Oracle VirtualBoxAfter imported, start the VM, then login use the credentials (username/password): root/hadoopThen go to the start_scripts folder use:1cd start_scripts/Add the port 7070 to the start_sandbox.sh by using the vi editor1vi start_sandbox.shScroll down to the end of the port line like ‘-p 2222:22 \’, insert the following code into the next line:1-p 7070:7070 \Then use “:wq” to save and exit the vi editor.Now stop the sandbox, and remove the existing sandbox12docker stop sandbox-hdpdocker rm sandbox-hdpThen restart the hdp1init 6Go the browser, go to the SSH client console “localhost:4200”Username is root, password is hadoop

entry.title: Fool
entry.content: Today is April Fool’s Day. I am fooled.

entry.title: Extending Bootstrap
entry.content: Here are some free plugins, add-ons, and component for bootstrapDatepickerBootstrap star ratingTabcordion.jsA simple jQuery plugin that transforms a set of Bootstrap tabs into a Bootstrap accordion.

entry.title: This is the solution for Josephus problem.
entry.content: Josephus ProblemFunction definition1public int[] myJosephus(int n, int k) {}Initialize data structure123int killIndex = 0;int[] res = new int[n];ArrayList<Integer> list = new ArrayList<>();Add all people into a list123for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) { list.add(i);}Kill people, add killIndex into result array and remove killed people from the list12345for (int i = list.size() - 1; i >= 0; i--) { killIndex = (killIndex + k - 1) % list.size(); res[n - i - 1] = list.get(killIndex); list.remove(killIndex); }Finally, remember to return res, and we can get the simulation of Josephus problem.
